sanskrit_verse:
असपिण्डा च या मातुरसगोत्रा च या पितुः ।
सा प्रशस्ता द्विजातीनां दारकर्मणि मैथुने ॥ ३.५॥ अमैथिनी
transliteration:
asapiṇḍā ca yā māturasagotrā ca yā pituḥ |
sā praśastā dvijātīnāṃ dārakarmaṇi maithune || 3.5|| amaithinī
sph_interpretive_translation: A woman who is neither a sapinda of the mother nor of the same gotra as the father is declared suitable for dvija men in the act of acquiring a wife.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from biological and spiritual lineages
Causation arises through lineage purity and ritual eligibility
Capacity-based responsibility lies in maintaining Varna-dharmic alignment
Restoration logic centers on preserving generational continuity and cosmic order
Consciousness alignment requires adherence to sanctioned procreative union
